results.title: Casuarina Equisetifolia
results.brief_description: One of a group of four films which look at various species of native trees growing on Stradbroke Island, Queensland. This film is about a species of pine tree called Casuarina Equisetifolia. Groves of these graceful trees grow on the rocky slopes above the ocean where cicadas hum in their branches and the long clusters of Casuarina needles shimmer silver and black in the breeze. The film follows the development of the small cones. The song of the small brown Honey-eater is heard on the sound track mixed in with the sound of a solo flute. Music performed by Nancy Tow.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a-part series. Explains the facilities available for medical examination and, if necessary, treatment of people who think they may have been exposed to sexually transmitted diseases.

results.title: Casual encounters of the infectious kind. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: Part one of a two-part series. Provides basic factual information about infectious diseases which are transmitted by sexual contact. Stresses the importance of seeking proper medical examination and, if necessary, treatment.

results.title: Castro's Cuba
results.creator_credit: Independent Television News (GB), Chris Sheridan and Keith Lambourne
results.brief_description: Cuba has been embargoed by the USA, abandoned by Russia, is one of the remaining issues of the Cold War and is close to bankruptcy, but the citizens of the country still fervently support their leader Fidel Castro. This documentary tells the story of Castro’s rise to power, the revolution of 1959, his reform programmes and his program of relations with the world’s superpowers as well as regional neighbours. It also investigates why this charismatic man is so adored by his citizens and how he has maintained his ‘beloved’ status for so long.

results.title: Castles of clay
results.creator_credit: Survival Anglia, Benchmark Films, Alan Root and Joan Root
results.brief_description: Narrated by Derek Jacobi this film examines the African termite and its intricately constructed termite hills. Special types of termites perform different functions inside the hills, including communication, cultivation of a special mushroom vital to their diet, care of the eggs, and preparation to start new colonies. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Castles made of sand
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford Film Productions and Paul Burnford
results.brief_description: Presents a visual ode to sandcastles and those who build them. Explores a sandcastle-building competition and leads the imagination to a variety of thoughts about sandcastle symbolism. Some are simple, some complex - perhaps parallelling the nature of their builders.

results.title: Castles and country: a view of Scotland
results.creator_credit: Random Films, National Benzole and Shirley Cobham
results.brief_description: Illustrates the work of the National Trust for Scotland in preserving castles, palaces, historical sites such as Glencoe, Iona, and the gardens of Crarae, Ardkinglass and Inverewe. Each sequence beings with a close-up, then opens out to a general view enabling appreciation of the architectural line or scene.

results.title: Castles and castanets
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Romantic Spain, warm with life and colour is the subject of this film. We see different aspects of its life - a hardworking farmer, a fisherman, a lady from Granada. The names themselves are evocative - Seville, seen at carnival time, the religious pageants in Malaga, Madrid with its new hotels and shops, the Costa Brava - and bull-fighting.

results.title: Castle of the walking dead
results.brief_description: Based on Edgar Allen Poe’s story “The Pit and the pendulum”, this ghastly story stars Christopher Lee as Count Regula, who has dismembered twelve virgins. After thrity five years, his indestructible servant puts him together again and hes back at his favourite hobby once more. If your passion is horrific movies - this one is gory enough to satisfy even the strongest need.

results.title: Castle of the Angel: a camera visit to the historic Castel St Angelo in Rome
results.brief_description: A tour of the Castle St Angelo, historic Roman fortress built in 135 AD by the Emperor Hadrian, showing the great halls, the dungeons, music rooms, and the private chambers of the popes. Against the background of the castle, the narrator recalls some of the events of history which took place within and about the castle. The works of great sculptors and painters, which adorn the castle, are shown in the film.
